Message.Title: I took a look at yahoo's two year chart on amzn,
Message.Msg: the volume line is getting thinner. very thin compared to two years ago. Must be a function of market cap. Support will collapse within x amount of time. that is a guarantee. x is a powerful variable. commands half the influence on the Cartesian plane.

there has to be a decent put strategy that will be profitable month to month and designed to be in play when the day of reckoning arrives. Tesla and Netflix joined the set this year. How do the fund managers justify such a reckless gamble?

"there has to be a decent put strategy that will be profitable " No such thing exists in the split second bot driven bitcoin markets. You will way more often then not find your crackhead option trade a day late and/or a dollar (or many dollarz) short of profit if you havent realized that already yet. You would have more success in tracking down a unicorn drinking from the fountaon of yourh located in The Land of Fariez and Dragonz then you would with finding a 'decent put option strategy". This Continued quest of crackheadz only works to keep it profitable for a stock scam to rise and platue repeatedly in a seemingly endless obliteration of optionz crackheadz. Sybs hopes this information helps. Good luck in your quest.

Message.Title: Option crackheadz are completely demoralized, weak handed shorts have thrown in the towel, and the markets have topped
Message.Msg: Short the pigz. short them immediately. short everything. Sell you sister on the street. sell everything that isn't nailed down. do it quickly.

Message.Title: barrons article rips the king of internet retailing
Message.Msg: Why did Barron's have to write such a bearish piece? Did the shorts put them up to it?

Message.Title: SEC filing
Message.Msg: Under an SEC filing dated 2 October Amazon has asked to be exempt from the requirement to report earnings on a quarterly basis. In an interview Jeff Bezos was quoted as saying "we dont report the number of Kindles we sell and would not intend to report sales numbers for set-top boxes, smart phones, or any other devices we develop. We would like to add profits to this list as we believe it only confuses our investors. Reporting only revenues would be more straight forward and easy to interpret."

Topic.Title: barrons article rips the king of internet retailing

Message.Msg: Barron's sees the writing on the wall. They have been printing positive articles about Amazon for years. We are approaching earnings season, revenues are slowing and expenses continue to climb. They want at least one article they can point to and say they "warned" investors. You will probably see a few more of these from different publications over the next several weeks.

What kinda cockeyed bs iz this??? Bezos : "Dear SEC, we would like to report 1/2 the equation with 2 unknownz for insolvable financial analysis purposez, and only report the one metric we have left still in the green but declining rapidly - revenuez" "PS how are the kidz? What do you say we make some use out of your furlow time? Meet me and my team at Beth Page on Thursday and we'll do a round of golf and dinner at the club house-my treat" Lets see if tHe SEC reps consider their 'consumer protection' mandate equally against their own interests on this request. Sybil doubts it. Sybs doesnt hold much hope of an SEC decision to deny such a BS request With the advent of weekly optionz, pre recorded rigged conferencez with hand picked analyst and softball questionz (hastingz - nflx), legalized congressional and staffer insider trading, etfs and derivativez of all types all backed by tax payer QE brought to you by the intersts of the few so to strip the wealth of the many.

It was a joke Sybs. Besides, as you note, with intellectually dishonest or incompetent analysts (how about they ask about whethermore or less labor is required per unit of total sales while retaining equivlanet service levels as the number of fulfillment centers increases? Trying to save on fuel -- which has made gross shipping cost as a % of net sales increase even with the massive buildout -- comes at a cost of having additional labor at a system level to get all the packages out from the locations nearest purchase). The thing is, more disclosure in't needed. The are many analyses that the analysts could do to expose the real economics here. They are culpable.

Message.Title: Bernanke fvck ed up, but he'z trapped and running out of bullets
Message.Msg: Instead of continuing qe 85 billion / month, he really needed to pump another 800 billion in a single shot last month to cover issuez associated with declining private sector payrollz, furlowz, and debt ceiling issuez on the horizon. The tea baggerz are the tail risk bozoz fvck in up the bernanke plan and jamming a steel rod in the spokes of the 'recovery'. Bernanke iz 700 billion short on this one and tge printing press iz running out of ink. At the current rate of bond purchasez and 'tweeking' the yeild curve, bernanke haz effectively turned the 30 bond into a 10 year bond and the maturitiez are dropping at an ALARMING rate. Bit wont be long before china refusez to show up at 2 and 10 year treasury auctionz for anything less then 5 and 15% , respectively. Anyonez guess when that will happen, but its coming, kidz. Bernanke iz the unwitting supporter of bitcoin used on silk road to buy coke. Benanke iz effectively ligitimizing bitcoin by murdering the dollar and now the treasury wants to tax bitcoin denominated salez instead of breaking up the currency people chose to use to avoid the global finance mess that the fed haz created . The treasury haz no choice ar this point but to accept bitcoin taxation or lose much needed revenuez to prop up insovant government spending and waste.

"It was a joke Sybs." Sybs takes people at their word - its easy to trick sybil because sybs thinks the best of the posting community and trusts that they post only honest and factual posts. The funny thing iz that you say its a joke, yet its entirely plausible. The biggest joke iz the stock market, yet people seem to go along with that one just fine.

Topic.Title: Bernanke fvck ed up, but he'z trapped and running out of bullets

Message.Msg: Stupid: Intrest Rates are a function of borrowing credit worthiness, capital availibility, borrower'z willingness / need to borrow, and lenderz willingness to lend.... Your simple mind equates that az long az interest rates stay low, borrowerz will borrow without regard - implying that low intrest rates with regard to nothing else.... at this time we are in the following situation: Bernanke iz making lots of capital available today at the expense of tomorrow Credit worthiness iz in the tank amongst the massez and az whole a country az muni bondz default and sheeple leverage up in student loanz, new carz, and sheiot from china and japan. But the ratingz dont reflect this -yet. Rates are being held artificially low, while those that need to borrow at these low rates cant, and those that dont need the money can get it if they want it. Lenderz 'banks' are taking on more and more risk in a search for yeild, except they are not loaning money to anyone that needz it, instead they are buying pig stox with it. The dollar iz being devalued to accomplish this Rates can either skyrocket and then we crash, a dynamic we are used to, or stay low az the market collapsez and willing ness to loan and borrow goez into the tank ... Sybil thinks that rates, although rizing will run post crash (ie 1978 carter after the 74-75 crash), despite what your simple mind iz able to process While home mortgagez and corporate bondz are low for those that 'qualify' , inflation in food, fertilizer and commoditiez iz high. Rates are high for those that need money, or they cant get it at all... So here'z whats gonna happen - rates are gonna swing wildly relative to their historical swingz az they have in the past 6 months, bernanke and the next fed will keep printing in attempt to 'calm' the markets. The yeild curve will invert az short term yeildz being bought by long term notes spike, and the markets will crash followed by high interest rates due to limited borrowing and lending

Topic.Title: Today, Barrons tries to punch a hole in the Amazon Bubble

Message.Msg: People have been bearish on these momentum stocks all year - and there has not been any pullback. AMZN, NFLX, TSLA - these are all going up not because of fundamentals, but because people continue to expect price increases. It is a self-fulfilling bubble, until the buying stops. There are some deep pockets throwing money at these stocks on the daily - I don't think it is the retail investor. Just a matter of when they have had their fill, these guys will back off and go in the opposite direction. These things can't go up forever, that is a fact. The question is how far are they going to stretch these valuations before some big players start dumping enough shares to offset their algorithms. I'd say sooner rather than later.
